com.navis.framework.portal

Class CrudDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.portal.CrudDelegate
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppointmentDelegate, ArgoDelegate, CapDelegate, EdiDelegate, InventoryDelegate, MensaDelegate, OrdersDelegate, RailDelegate, RoadDelegate, VesselDelegate

    public class CrudDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
    Static access to the business tier for DB-related queries.

      • requestPopulate

        public static BizResponse requestPopulate(UserContext inUserContext,
                                          java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                          FieldChanges inFieldChanges)
        Used by the presentation tier to obtain default values for an entity when the user is about to be presented with a form that will allow him to create a new instance. We create a temporary instance and let the underlying machinery populate it extract the values, then delete the temporary entity.

      • doDomainQueryInMultipleThreads

        public static java.util.List<ValueHolder> doDomainQueryInMultipleThreads(@NotNull
                                                                         UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         MessageCollector inOutMc,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         java.lang.String inThreadGroupName,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         MetafieldId inPkMetafieldId,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         DomainQuery inDomainQuery,
                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                         java.lang.Integer inMaxQueryDurationInSeconds,
                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                         java.lang.Integer inThreadNumber,
                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                         java.lang.Integer inBatchSize)
        This executes a given domain query in a few threads. Each thread executes a few batches to make transactions smaller and prevent database limits violations. This method is useful specifically, when a massive number of values are fetched.

        Don't use this method in case of fetching a small number of results, it could be counterproductive. The good use case example would be fetching 10,000 of results with 50 fields in each.

        This call supports ordering. This means if the domainQuery has Order By clause, the result will be returned in the same order as it would be a single thread with no batches. In order to guarantee the ordering, it does final validation : fecthing gkeys one more time. If current result is different in a sense of sizing or ordering, we register an exception in messaeg collector. Why inconsistency may occur? Let's imagine we pre-fetched gkeys in a certain order and an entity was modified. The fetching values in this case may return values in an incorrect order.

        If no order by clause is presented in the domain query, the method tolerates any possible changes to the fetched list during fetching. In other words if pre-fetched gkey size = 10,000 and the result of the method = 9,999 no error will be registered

        To test your domainquery for the best number of threads and batch sizes, override MultiThreadBatchedDomainQuerySaTestSuite

        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message collector - must be checked after execution
        inThreadGroupName - The name for the thread group. This name will be visible by tools such as JConsole. This parameter is convinient for monitoring and diagnostic
        inPkMetafieldId - primary key metafield for the domain query driving entity
        inDomainQuery - The domain query to execute
        inMaxQueryDurationInSeconds - The thread timeout duration in seconds. This is to prevent threads hanging. The default timeout is 120 seconds. If the domain query takes longer time to execute and could not be adjusted with batch size, longer timout is required.
        inThreadNumber - The number of thread to run the domain query. The default thread number is 4. If it is necessary to run more threads, this setter can be used. The number depends on the number of CPU of the Tomcat server.
        inBatchSize - The size of all batches. The default batch size = 1000 due to the Oracle limitation for IN predicate. In most cases this is an optimal size, however it could be set from 2 to 1000. This parameter manages duration of transactions to fetch values. For instance if we know the domain query fetches 1000 values in > 10 seconds, slow query will be logged. We can avoid it by making batch size = 500 or less. In this case we will execite more queries but they will be shorter.
        Returns:
        Lis of ValueObjects

      • doDomainQueryInMultipleThreads

        public static java.util.List<ValueHolder> doDomainQueryInMultipleThreads(@NotNull
                                                                         UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         MessageCollector inOutMc,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         java.lang.String inThreadGroupName,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         MetafieldId inPkMetafieldId,
                                                                         @NotNull
                                                                         DomainQuery inDomainQuery)
        This method is the same as above, but uses default values for timeout (120 seconds), number of threads (4) and batch size (1000)
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user context
        inOutMc - message collector - must be checked after execution
        inThreadGroupName - The name for the thread group. This name will be visible by tools such as JConsole. This parameter is convinient for monitoring and diagnostic
        inPkMetafieldId - primary key metafield for the domain query driving entity
        inDomainQuery - The domain query to execute
        Returns:
        Lis of ValueObjects

      • requestQueryAll

        public static BizResponse requestQueryAll(java.lang.String inEntityName,
                                          java.lang.String[] inDesiredFields,
                                          Bounded inBounds,
                                          Ordering[] inOrderings)
        API intended for obtaining a list of all entities, or a range of them.

        inEntityName - the name of the entity
        inDesiredFields - array of desired field ids
        inBounds - QueryBounds or null for all
        inOrderings - array of Ordering objects, or null for undefined ordering

      • requestMasterAndDetail

        public static BizResponse requestMasterAndDetail(java.lang.String inMasterClass,
                                                 java.io.Serializable inMasterPrimaryKey,
                                                 java.lang.String inRelationshipField,
                                                 java.lang.String[] inMasterFields,
                                                 java.lang.String[] inDetailFields)
        Request a master object and its detail objects

        Parameters:
        inMasterClass - the class name of the master object
        inMasterPrimaryKey - primary key of the master object
        inRelationshipField - the fieldId of the one-to-many relationship from master to detail
        inMasterFields - fields to be returned in the master object
        inDetailFields - fields to be returned in the detail objects
        Returns:
        standard BizResponse with the results.

      • updateConfigSetting

        @Nullable
public static BizResponse updateConfigSetting(UserContext inUserContext,
                                                         java.lang.String inConfigId,
                                                         java.lang.Number inScopeLevel,
                                                         java.io.Serializable inPrimaryKey,
                                                         java.io.Serializable inValue)
        API to update a ConfigSetting via the BizPortal. A ConfigSetting will be created or updated that will apply to the user at the scope level defined by inScopeLevel.
        Parameters:
        inUserContext - user
        inConfigId - The id of the Config to be updated
        inScopeLevel - 2=operator, 3= complex, etc. (1=global not allowed!)
        inValue - the new value for the setting
        Returns:
        a BizResponse

      • createExecutablePredicate

        @Nullable
public static PredicateIntf createExecutablePredicate(UserContext inUserContext,
                                                                 ValueHolder inPredicateValueHolder,
                                                                 java.util.Map inPredicateParms)
        Converts a ValueHolder containing the predicate to an executeable predicate. new 2005-10-15 JJS. Similar code was found in several places in the presentation tier, and it is incorrect as it accesses a business tier entity. Hence consolidating this sin in one place.
        Parameters:
        inPredicateValueHolder -
